heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 04 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 8.4°C) and outside temperature (down 6.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 721 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 11.4°C), cloud levels (up 1074 m), outside temperature (up 9.2°C), and dew point temperature (up 6.5°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 721.3m lower than yesterday, 186.4m lower than the past week, 1073.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 835m to 3910m and averaged 1464.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and it’s dark. The weather will likely remain the same.
